ddf.catalog.source.solr

Class SolrFilterDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • ddf.catalog.filter.FilterDelegate<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrQuery>
      • ddf.catalog.source.solr.SolrFilterDelegate

  • public class SolrFilterDelegate
extends FilterDelegate<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrQuery>
    Translates filter-proxy calls into Solr query syntax.

      • propertyIsLike

        public org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrQuery propertyIsLike(String propertyName,
                                                             String pattern,
                                                             boolean isCaseSensitive)
        Description copied from class: FilterDelegate
        Compares the value associated with a property to a regular expression pattern.

        Regular expression special characters are defined as WILDCARD_CHAR, SINGLE_CHAR, and ESCAPE_CHAR.

        Overrides:
        propertyIsLike in class FilterDelegate<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrQuery>
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of property to compare
        pattern - regular expression pattern to match
        isCaseSensitive - case-sensitivity boolean
        Returns:
        result of regular expression operation

      • propertyIsNull

        public org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrQuery propertyIsNull(String propertyName)
        This builds a "is null" query based on the property name provided. Since no type is provided with this method, we build a OR chained expression with anonymous field names. The actually expression uses a negative ranged query expression. The null query needs to be used in order for this expression to play well with other nested expressions. The query used is outlined in: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17044661/how-to-filter-search-by-values-that-are-not-available/17045097#17045097
        Overrides:
        propertyIsNull in class FilterDelegate<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrQuery>
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property to null check against.
        Returns:
        the solr query with the is null expression.
